history.origin: The Pink Panthers are an international network of jewel thieves believed to consist of members mainly from Serbia, Montenegro, and other Balkan states.

notableHeists.name: Graff Diamonds Heist
notableHeists.details: Two men dressed as business executives stole 47 pieces of jewelry in less than three minutes.

notableHeists.name: Harry Winston Robbery
notableHeists.details: Robbers dressed as women entered the store and took nearly all the stock.

methods.disguises: The gang is known for elaborate disguises, including dressing as women, tourists, and business professionals.
methods.planning: Operations are meticulously planned, often involving scouting the location weeks in advance.
methods.execution: Heists are carried out quickly — often within minutes — to minimize risk.

documentaries.title: Smash & Grab: The Story of the Pink Panthers
documentaries.description: A mix of interviews and dramatizations exploring the history and operations of the Pink Panthers.

tvShows.title: Pink Panther Animated Series
tvShows.description: Although fictional and comedic, the animated Pink Panther character and TV show drew loose inspiration from the gang's reputation for elegance, stealth, and cleverness.

books.title: The Pink Panthers: The Greatest Thieves in the World
books.author: David Farrier
books.description: An investigative look at the rise and ongoing influence of the Pink Panthers.

trivia: The group was nicknamed 'Pink Panthers' by Interpol after a 2003 heist in which a stolen diamond was found hidden in a jar of face cream — a trick seen in the 1963 'Pink Panther' film.
They are suspected of stealing over $500 million worth of jewels worldwide.
